context: The word 'leidsite' is the past plural second person form of the Estonian verb 'leidma', meaning to find, discover, or locate something. It corresponds to English 'you found' (plural/formal). The dictionary shows this word has multiple meanings including: 1) discovering/locating things (people, objects), 2) selecting/chosing from options, 3) finding solutions, 4) perceiving/noticing conditions, 5) forming opinions/judgments, and 6) obtaining/receiving something. In the given form 'leidsite', it specifically means 'you (plural/formal) found'.
